content.description: Sit start with a big right hand edge, a left hand palming the face, and a foot out right.  From there, establish your feet, gain a right hand edge, then a left hand sidepull-pinch, follow to a right hand sidepull-edge, gain a huge left hand sidepull, toss to the lip, throw a heel on, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is clear but is sloping.
content.location: This ascends the center of Declassified Boulder's west face.
This is on the Southwest corner of the Declassified Boulder. The rock is solid. The downclimb is on the Southeast corner.

content.description:
Cab Driving Aristocrat climbs solid rock and employs a nice variety of holds.

Stand start with a left hand crimp and a right hand sidepull, both are roughly four feet off the deck.  At that point, hit the mono pocket, bump the right hand up to the sidepull/undercling, dance the feet, and make a move to the lip (crux?).  From there on out, it's a jug fest with a solid topout.
content.protection: A few pads, the immediate landing is great, but is surrounded by trees and rocks.
content.location: It is located on the east face of Declassified Boulder.
